name: Hotel Parco dei Principi

reviews.title: Beautiful views, Architecture, nice personnel
reviews.text: We stayed here in mid October as part of a tour. This Hotel was designed by Gio Ponti and is a beautiful example of mid century modern elegance. Our room was on the fourth floor overlooking the Bay of Naples with Mt. Vesuvius in the distance. Simply breathtaking! The weather was beautiful and still warm. Bring washcloths, as two of the three hotels in which we stayed on our tour didn't supply them. Wifi is good in lobby as with most hotels. Bring conditioner for your hair if you need to or you can buy it there. You will also need one or two of those two prong converters for charging up your iPad to Face Time with family back home. Have a bottle of Dramamine if you get motion sickness. Getting up and down Sorrento requires a lot of hairpin curves.

My husband and I spend 10 days in the hotel in the mid of September. We really enjoyed our stay. The sea and Vesuvius views from our sea-view room were stunning. The room itself was spacious and clean. My adult sun, who came to the same hotel for shorter period of time, got garden-view room, but it also was spacious and clean. One can say that rooms’ interior is outdated with lacking of furniture, but it is definitely stylish and keeping faith to Gio Ponti design, and for my part I prefer cleanliness to dusty decoration.
reviews.title: Unforgettable stay in Sorrento area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel grounds are very nice with big and well-kept garden and historical villa of princess Gorchakova.
reviews.title: Faulty tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Water in the sea is clear and sunbeds and umbrellas were always available in the beach.
reviews.title: amazing, but take a balanced view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The offer for breakfast did not differ from day to day, but quality of food was good. I would recommend having variety of choice for dinner to the hotel.
reviews.title: Outstanding view with a nice hotel
Wish we could go back!
reviews.text: We stayed here in May. The weather was great for sight seeing, but we so wish we could have used the lovely pool or had a swim in the sea.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff eas were more than friendly. The food was amazing and we had so much fun in the lounge.
reviews.title: Wonderful Throwback in Time

reviews.text: Our room was large clean and comfortable with unforgettable views.
reviews.title: Ok
Great views and water access! Can walk to core.
reviews.text: The hotel has a great walking distance to town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What else to say but PERFECT!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The purpose of our trip was to attend our friends' wedding, during which we were fortunate to viisit Relais Blu in Massa Lubrense, definitely worth the trip out for the views of Capri. Our wedding party was dotted across Sorrento and I can honestly say we could not have chosen a more perfect hotel for our stay in the Parco Dei Principi. We were naturally nervous about travelling with a 6 month old baby but the staff could not have been more courteous and helpful and made a fuss over our little girl,they provided a cot for her made up daily with beautiful linens. Our room had a balcony etched into the rock, from which we were able to enjoy stunning views of Naples. We were sent up a complementary fruit platter on our first night, a lovely touch. It is clear to see why this is a 5* hotel, from the idyllic swimming pool setting, unsurpassed in my many many trips for its tranquility and beauty, to the private beach which truly has the wow factor onto the harmonious and cohesive public areas where you would always be made to feel welcome and attended to, should you so require. Having visited other regions of Italy and Sardinia through a spectrum of hotels and experiences, this hotel stands out as a sanctuary of beauty, quite a rose amongst the noisy, dusty bustle of Sorrento town. Although I woul dnot visit Sorrento again as it is personally not to my taste, I would use the hotel group again without hesitation and would highly recommend the hotel to those who wish to visit Sorrento. Bravo!
reviews.title: First trip abroad with the little nipper/bambino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spend there 2 nights. Wonderful garden, terrace over the sea, where you can enjoy the sunset, outside pool. You don't really need to go out of the hotel. There is a piano player at the terrace during the evening drink and the dinner, so skip your shorts. Extremely romantic place and the staff does its best to keep it so.
reviews.title: Breathtaking view

reviews.text: We rented a boat to Capri--another terrific place. You may also visit Pompei and Vesuvius--it's 30-40 min trip by car.
reviews.title: Absolutely gorgeous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent three nights at the Parco dei Principi in June 2012, and was completely blown away by the entire experience. First of all, the setting is hard to describe; the hotel is surrounded by botanical park-quality gardens, and then backs straight up to a sheer rock cliff that overlooks the Bay of Naples. To get to the pool and the little private beach (black volcanic sand -- SO cool), one takes an elevator that is literally carved into the rock of the cliff wall.
reviews.title: stylish sorrento

reviews.text: As to the hotel itself -- the staff were all lovely and helpful, the food was excellent (and served in a beautiful setting with a breathtaking view), and the rooms were spacious and well-appointed with comfy beds. The side of the hotel in which I stayed had balconies overlooking the bay (wow...!) and I was able to leave the balcony door open all night long in order to let the breeze in and hear the waves pounding against the cliffs. (Note -- the air conditioner turns off automatically if you leave the door open, but that only makes sense. It turns right back on when the door closes.)
reviews.title: One of the nicer hotels in Sorrento.

reviews.text: Stayed with a tour group for six nights. Just an OK hotel with a great view (if you get one of those rooms) but NO air conditioning. The temps were at least bearable if you left the outside door open at night. The rooms are furnished with the bare minimum and they could use new sheets and mattresses. The restauant personel were very nice and attentive but the food was just OK. The walk to the main square is only about a 20 min walk but watch out for the traffic.
reviews.title: No A/C

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in early september 2012, and this is my 3rd time in the Sorrento because i just love Italy and there is so much to do In this area. The positives of this hotel is it has large bedrooms and although the decor wasnt to my personal tatse it had everything you needed and a large balcony. The staff were very pleasant to us although at breakfast it could sometimes be a bit disorganised although this was never really a big issue and did not impact our stay. The views from this hotel are amazing and the beach area is a real plus with plenty of sun beds, i wasnt too keen on the pool area as it was a bit run down and i think it could do with a refurb. The food and drinks were expensive as are most hotels however there was plenty of choice at breakfast (maily continental) and i did enjoy it. This hotel is ideally located for the restaurants in Saint Agnello which are very close, reasonably priced, cheaper than sorrento and full of italians so you know they are good! It is about a 20 minute walk into Sorrento, there is a shuttle bus from the hotel but this needs to be booked in advance and doesnt run after 7pm. Overall a very enjoyable stay, hotels in sorrento can be expensive so i think this was quite reasonable, it just needs a few tweaks to make it perfect, i would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with a 5 star view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Warning, when booking a pre-paid , non-refundable room, insurance may be no help in the event that you have to cancel for whatever cause.
reviews.title: Warning in case of cancellation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Understandably insurance companies require a Confirmation of cancellation letter from the Travel agent or the hotel, but in our case neither the travel agent ` Venere ` or the hotel ` The Parco Principi, Sorrento `were willing to issue one.
reviews.title: Great views and service

reviews.text: Phone calls to Venere were answered only occasionally by people who could speak English clearly enough to be understood and who could understand English. Requests for a confirmation of cancellation letter resulted in them phoning the hotel asking for a refund, in turn the hotel sent us an abrupt e mail telling us we were not entitled to a refund. E mails to the hotel assuring them that we were not asking for a refund, just a cancellation letter and we, again, received an e mail telling us that we could not have a refund !! Venere, eventually sent an e mail to confess that they did not have the facility to send a confirmation of cancellation letter, and that maybe, a confirmation of booking would be sufficient for our insurance company!!
reviews.title: Superb view and Hospitality

description: The extraordinarily stunning views of the sea from the terraces of the rooms in the Parco dei Principi, which is practically suspended between sky and sea, make this, an idyllic and fairytale resort and the surroundings of the hotel are every bit as magical, from the elegant gardens with their tall palms and age-old trees, flowers and plants, to the sea and the private beach. The Hotel Parco dei Principi, was designed and built by the architect Gio Ponti and it is a masterpiece of contemporary art. Using exclusive lines, perfect plays of colours and meticulous attention to furnishings, Gio Ponti created the first "design hotel" of the Sixties. Each part of the property has been kept exactly as it was: all the interiors are original including the majolica tiles, the ceramics and the floors while outside the 27 hectares of historical gardens and the spectacular terrace allow to be closed to nature and sea. Created as a place of harmony, pleasure and relaxation, the hotel offers guests comforts which have been studied down to the smallest detail and is the essence of exquisite hospitality, well-being and relax. The private beach, the charming sea-water swimming pool set in the prestigious and elegant gardens, the Wellness Centre and the Fitness Centre provide guests with fascinating emotions and sensations.
